boat.construction_details: Carvel round bilge Mahogany on oak Lead Keel Canvas covered decks.
boat.full_description:
Built in 1938 by Elkins of Christchurch and bought by a couple from Yarmouth (Isle of Wight) called Diane and Richard; hence her original name of 'Diric'.

After World War II 'Diric' was sold to Col. Mitchell, who lived near Yarmouth, and taught Sea Scouts to sail. She was sold in the 1970s to John Sleight and then transferred to his brother Colin in the 1990s.

In 1998 she was bought by Steve Pavey who changed her name to 'Diane' and replaced her Stuart Turner with a Britt engine. She was bought by Nick and Jill Bredon in 2008, who undertook an extensive refit/rebuild at the Classic Boat Museum, Newport IoW.

In 2010, 'Diane' was winner of the YOGAFF Concourse d'Elegance. In 2015, her new owner, Edmund Hewitt changed her name back to her original one 'Diric'.
boat.name: Diric
boat.short_description: A classic gaff cutter, built 1938 by Elkins of Chichester, 'Diric' takes her name from her first owners Richard and Diane, who lived in Yarmouth IoW. She has also been called 'Diane'.
